instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on from charger but powers on with battery.
threads.message:
got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> it will not power with the charger, if i plug the battery in it turns on and runs perfectly. charges the battery runs on the battery and it will even run on just the charger and no battery if you power it on with the battery and then unplug it. what would be the likely culprit here? 

Thanks 
Nate

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on from charger but powers on with battery.
threads.message:
So if you have battery and charger it powers on?
I would blame the charger.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on from charger but powers on with battery.
threads.message: hey g.beard thanks for dropping in. If i have battery it powers on if i have battery and charger it powers on. if i plug battery in then power on the system unplug the battery with the charger still plugged in it will continue to run on the charger.  and like i said before it will run the battery perfectly.   unfortunately it is not the charger.. i fixed 3 boards this morning with this charger and working on a 5th one right now and its been running it perfect without a battery installed.  so i know it is not the charger.  also tested with a second charger before and it was no different.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on from charger but powers on with battery.
threads.message: 85W charger? PPBUS voltage on charger alone? Does it get orange light?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont power on from charger but powers on with battery.
threads.message:
sorry forgot to post back. found out after my last post my assistant took my 80W and put a 60w in the wall so it was all good.  the little things that throw you off haha.
Thankss.
